definitions.text: the activity of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose
examples: he gave me an assist with the housework
could not walk without assistance
rescue party went to their aid
offered his help in unloading

definitions.text: a person who contributes to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort or purpose
examples: my invaluable assistant
they hired additional help to finish the work
visual aids in teaching
of no avail
there's no help for it

definitions.text: give help or assistance; be of service
examples: Everyone helped out during the earthquake
Can you help me carry this table?
She never helps around the house
These pills will help the patient
This will help to prevent accidents

definitions.text: abstain from doing; always used with a negative
examples: I can't help myself--I have to smoke
She could not help watching the sad spectacle

definitions.text: help to some food; help with food or drink
examples: I served him three times, and after that he helped himself
This money will help the development of literacy in developing countries
She helped herself to some of the office supplies
New slipcovers will help the old living room furniture
